select ct.ct_sub ct_sub, count(ch.ch_num) cnt, ct.ct_period ct_period, ct.ct_num ct_num, ct.ct_star ct_star, ct.ct_hit ct_hit from (select ct_num, ct_sub,ct_period,ct_star,ct_hit ,rownum r from (select * from content where cc_num = #{cc_num} order by 1 desc)) ct,
chapter ch where ct.ct_num = ch.ct_num(+) group by ct.ct_sub, ct.ct_period, ct.ct_star , ct.ct_num, ct.ct_hit order by 1 desc

select distinct cc.cc_name cc_name, ct.ct_sub ct_sub, round(cl.cl_end - sysdate) finish_date, cl.p_num, cl.ct_num from cont_cate cc, content ct, myclass cl where p_num = #{p_num} and ct.ct_num=#{ct_num} and ct.cc_num=cc.cc_num and ct.ct_num=cl.ct_num and cl_end > sysdate
select count(ch_num) cnt from myclass where p_num = #{p_num} and ct_num = #{ct_num}
select count(ch_num) cnt from myclass where p_num = #{p_num} and ct_num = #{ct_num} and cl_done=1
select ct_num from myclass where p_num = #{p_num} and cl_end > sysdate group by ct_num
